filmography.title: One Week
filmography.role_description: A newlywed who attempts to build a portable house for his bride, only to find that a rival has swapped the numbering on the crates.
filmography.plot: A newlywed couple attempts to build a house from a prefabricated kit, unaware that a rival has sabotaged the assembly instructions.

filmography.title: The Scarecrow
filmography.role_description: A farmhand who competes with his roommate for the love of the farmer's daughter, engaging in a mechanical breakfast and a chase with a 'mad' dog.
filmography.plot: Two farmhands compete for the same girl, leading to a chase scene involving a mechanical scarecrow.

filmography.title: Neighbors
filmography.role_description: A young man living in a tenement who falls for the girl next door, despite the violent feud between their families.
filmography.plot: Two lovers from feuding families try to be together despite the physical barriers and fences separating their tenement buildings.

filmography.title: The Goat
filmography.role_description: A wanderer who is mistaken for a notorious outlaw named 'Dead Shot Dan' after his face appears on a wanted poster.
filmography.plot: A tramp is mistaken for a dangerous criminal and pursued by the police across the city.

filmography.title: The Playhouse
filmography.role: The Audience / The Orchestra / The Actors
filmography.role_description: A stagehand who dreams he is playing every role in a variety show, showcasing groundbreaking special effects.
filmography.plot: A stagehand dreams that he is every member of the cast and audience in a vaudeville show.

filmography.title: The Boat
filmography.role_description: A father who builds a boat named the 'Damfino' inside his house and tries to take his family on a disastrous sea voyage.
filmography.plot: A man builds a boat inside his house and tries to launch it with his family, facing one nautical disaster after another.

filmography.title: Cops
filmography.role_description: A well-meaning young man who accidentally offends the entire Los Angeles police department and is chased by hundreds of officers.
filmography.plot: Through a series of mishaps, a young man manages to get chased by the entire police force of a large city.

filmography.title: The Electric House
filmography.role_description: A botany student mistakenly hired to engineer an automated home, leading to chaos when a rival reprograms the gadgets.
filmography.plot: A man installs electricity and gadgets in a house to modernize it, but a rival sabotages the system to cause mayhem.

filmography.title: Three Ages
filmography.role_description: The protagonist in three parallel stories set in the Stone Age, the Roman Age, and the Modern Age, competing for love.
filmography.plot: A satire of D.W. Griffith's 'Intolerance', showing the same love story set in three different historical eras.

filmography.title: Our Hospitality
filmography.role_description: A young man who returns south to claim his inheritance, only to find himself in the middle of a deadly family feud.
filmography.plot: A man returns to his Appalachian homestead to claim his inheritance, unaware that he is the target of a long-standing family feud.

filmography.title: Sherlock Jr.
filmography.role_description: A movie theater projectionist and aspiring detective who dreams himself into the screen to solve a crime.
filmography.plot: A film projectionist longs to be a detective, and puts his meagre skills to work when he is framed by a rival for stealing his girlfriend's father's pocketwatch.

filmography.title: The Navigator
filmography.role_description: A pampered, wealthy heir who finds himself adrift on a massive ocean liner with only the woman who rejected him for company.
filmography.plot: Two spoiled rich people find themselves trapped alone on an empty passenger ship drifting in the ocean.

filmography.title: Seven Chances
filmography.role_description: A junior partner at a brokerage firm who must marry by 7:00 PM on his 27th birthday to inherit $7 million.
filmography.plot: A man learns he will inherit a fortune if he marries by 7 p.m. that day, leading to a chaotic chase by hundreds of prospective brides.

filmography.title: Go West
filmography.role_description: A drifter who travels west to make his fortune and forms a touching friendship with a cow named Brown Eyes.
filmography.plot: A young man who doesn't fit in anywhere travels west and befriends a cow while trying to save a ranch.

filmography.title: Battling Butler
filmography.role_description: A pampered millionaire who pretends to be a champion boxer to impress a girl and her family.
filmography.plot: A wealthy dandy pretends to be a professional boxer to impress the family of the girl he loves, but then has to actually fight.

filmography.title: The General
filmography.role_description: A Southern railroad engineer who single-handedly chases down Union spies to retrieve his stolen locomotive and his girlfriend.
filmography.plot: When Union spies steal an engineer's beloved locomotive, he pursues it single-handedly and straight through enemy lines.

filmography.title: College
filmography.role_description: A bookworm who tries to become a star athlete to win the heart of the most popular girl in school.
filmography.plot: A studious young man tries to excel in athletics to win the girl he loves, despite his lack of physical prowess.

filmography.title: Steamboat Bill, Jr.
filmography.role_description: The effete, ukulele-playing son of a gruff riverboat captain who must prove his worth during a massive cyclone.
filmography.plot: The son of a riverboat captain falls in love with the daughter of his father's business rival, culminating in a dangerous hurricane.

filmography.title: The Cameraman
filmography.role_description: A tintype photographer who buys a movie camera to impress a girl working for MGM newsreels, leading to chaos.
filmography.plot: A hopeless romantic tries to become a newsreel cameraman to win the heart of a secretary at the newsreel office.

filmography.title: Spite Marriage
filmography.role_description: A trouser presser who is tricked into marrying a stage actress who only wants to make her former lover jealous.
filmography.plot: A humble man marries a stage actress who is only using him to spite her old flame, leading them into a rum-running adventure.

filmography.title: Sunset Boulevard
filmography.role_description: A brief but poignant cameo as himself, one of the 'Waxworks' bridge players keeping company with a faded silent star.
filmography.plot: A screenwriter develops a dangerous relationship with a faded film star determined to make a triumphant return.

filmography.title: Limelight
filmography.role_description: A near-blind pianist who performs a legendary comedic duet with Charlie Chaplin in a music hall.
filmography.plot: A fading comedian and a suicidally despondent ballet dancer must look to each other to find meaning and hope in their lives.

filmography.title: It's a Mad Mad Mad Mad World
filmography.role_description: A boatman who helps Spencer Tracy's character pursue the treasure hunters in this massive ensemble comedy.
filmography.plot: A group of motorists witness a car crash in the California desert, and after the driver's dying words indicate the location of hidden loot, they turn against each other in a race across the state.

filmography.title: The Railrodder
filmography.role_description: An aging man who accidentally travels across Canada on a railway track speeder in this dialogue-free travelogue comedy.
filmography.plot: An older man crosses Canada from east to west on a railway track speeder, engaging in visual gags along the way.

filmography.title: Film
filmography.role_description: A man attempting to escape being perceived by an 'eye' (E) in this avant-garde short written by Samuel Beckett.
filmography.plot: A silent short film depicting a man trying to avoid being seen by anyone or anything, including himself.

filmography.title: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
filmography.role_description: A befuddled old man searching for his long-lost children, running laps around the Seven Hills of Rome.
filmography.plot: A wily slave schemes to win his freedom by helping his young master woo the girl next door.
